Class com.penthera.virtuososdk.service.VirtuosoServiceStarter

com.penthera.virtuososdk.service

Class VirtuosoServiceStarter

  • java.lang.Object
    • BroadcastReceiver
      • com.penthera.virtuososdk.service.VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler
        • com.penthera.virtuososdk.service.VirtuosoServiceStarter
  • public abstract class VirtuosoServiceStarter extends VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler
    This class starts the service. An application must derive from this and register the class as a broadcast receiver in order to provide the notifications for the service to operate as a Foreground Service. Details of the abstract methods that must be overridden can be found in the abstract base class VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler. An example of an implementation for this can be found in the demo projects available with Download2Go. The android manifest file will need to contain a definition for the derived service starter class such as: 
      
      <receiver android:name="com.penthera.sdkdemo.SDKDemoServiceStarter"
 			android:enabled="true"
 			android:process=":starter"
 			android:label="SDKDemoServiceStarter"
 			android:directBootAware="true">
 			<intent-filter>
 				<action android:name="android.intent.action.BOOT_COMPLETED"/>
 				<action android:name="android.intent.action.QUICKBOOT_POWERON"/>
 				<action android:name="com.htc.intent.action.QUICKBOOT_POWERON"/>
 				<action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.SERVICE_NOTIFICATION_UPDATE" />
 				<action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.DOWNLOAD_UPDATE"/>
 				<action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.CONFIGURE_VIRTUOSO_SERVICE_LOGGING"/>
 				<action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.BACKPLANE_SYNC_DEVICE" />
 				<action android:name="android.intent.action.PACKAGE_REMOVED" />
 				<action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.START_SERVICE" />
 				<data android:scheme="package"/>
 			</intent-filter>
 			<intent-filter>
 				<action android:name="android.intent.action.BOOT_COMPLETED"/>
 				<action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.START_SERVICE" />
 				<category android:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT" />
 			</intent-filter>

 		</receiver>

      getForegroundServiceNotification 
      abstract Notification getForegroundServiceNotification(Context context, Intent forIntent)
      This method is required to return a valid notification each time it is called.
      public abstract Notification getForegroundServiceNotification(Context context, Intent forIntent)
      Description copied from class: VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler
      This method is required to return a valid notification each time it is called. The notification will be used as the foreground notification for the service, if the method returns null then the download service may not be able to go into foreground mode and continue downloading when the app is in the background.
      This method works in combination with VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler.getForegroundServiceNotificationProvider(). If a valid class is returned from getAssetForegroundServiceNotification then that method is used to request all notification updates related to asset downloads and the download engine state. If not then this method will be called for each notification.
      In either case, this method is called to get a generic foreground notification when the foreground service is first started. That notification will be used where the service goes into foreground mode for reasons other than downloading content. For instance, the service uses foreground mode to protect itself from being shut down prematurely when it is servicing push notification actions or deleting content in the background after expiry.
      There are some limitations on what can be shown within a notification returned via this method because it is passed across process boundaries. The Notification object implements Parcelable, and in this case it will be added as a Parcellable extra to an Intent. There is a size limit on the total size of objects passing between processes in Android, and that will be applied to this notification.
      Parameters:
      context - A context which can be used in generating the Notification
      forIntent - An intent containing the details of the notification required, can be null if the service is being started / restarted and no download context is known.
      Returns:
      The notification, which will be passed over a process boundary to be used by the download service.
      getForegroundServiceNotificationProvider 
      abstract java.lang.Class getForegroundServiceNotificationProvider()
      This method enables the app to provide a class implementing IForegroundNotificationProvider which will be instantiated within the download service and used for generating Notifications during asset download.
      public abstract java.lang.Class getForegroundServiceNotificationProvider()
      Description copied from class: VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler
      This method enables the app to provide a class implementing IForegroundNotificationProvider which will be instantiated within the download service and used for generating Notifications during asset download. This method simply returns the class definition, which will be passed to the service. If a non-null response is provided then the class will be instantiated within the service process and requests for notifications will be sent to it instead of being directed to the getForegroundServiceNotification() method. Notifications generated via that class will not be passed over a process boundary and do not have any size limits imposed by the Parcellable property. The provided class must use a default constructor. Care and consideration should be given to the fact that the class instance will exist in another process to the UI and will need to create duplicate resources within that process for any helper classes used to generate the notifications, such as image loaders or database references.
      If a class is provided which does not implement the interface then this will be logged and the provided class will be ignored.
      Returns:
      The class which should be instantiated within the service to use for notifications.

      shouldRemoteUpdateNotification 
      boolean shouldRemoteUpdateNotification(Context aContext, Intent aIntent)
      This method determines whether notification update requests received within the service starter should be passed through to getForegroundServiceNotification() and result in a new notification being passed back to the service.
      public boolean shouldRemoteUpdateNotification(Context aContext, Intent aIntent)
      Description copied from class: VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler
      This method determines whether notification update requests received within the service starter should be passed through to getForegroundServiceNotification() and result in a new notification being passed back to the service. By default, if a foreground notification provider is returned from VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler.getForegroundServiceNotificationProvider() then this method returns false. This is because it is anticipated that the foreground notification provider running within the download service will provide the notification updates.
      This method may be overridden in order to filter on specific intent actions in cases where a notification needs to be generated from the main service starter process and not from within the service. A complimentary method within IForegroundNotificationProvider enables filtering within the service to prevent notifications from being generated on specific intent actions.
      Parameters:
      aContext - The context which would be passed to getForegroundServiceNotification(Context context, Intent forIntent )
      aIntent - The intent which would be passed to getForegroundServiceNotification(Context context, Intent forIntent )
      Returns:
      True if the notification should be generated and passed to the service, False if the request should be ignored.
      See Also:
      IForegroundNotificationProvider.shouldUpdateForegroundServiceNotificationOnIntent(Context, Intent)
